SEARCH
Module io.jstach.ezkv.xml
Package io.jstach.ezkv.xml

Class XMLKeyValuesMedia

java.lang.Object
io.jstach.ezkv.xml.XMLKeyValuesMedia
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyValuesMedia, KeyValuesServiceProvider, KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder
public class XMLKeyValuesMedia extends Object implements KeyValuesMedia
Parses XML to KeyValues.

The constants in this class are important and describe parameters that can be set on the KeyValuesResource.

XML is not flat and is more of a tree where as EZKV KeyValues are and only support string values. Thus the parser flattens the XML based on some heuristics.

Here is an example of the default flattening of the following XML: 
<a>
	<b>1</b>
	<b>2.0
		<c>3</c>
	</b>
	<d>value</d>
 <e f="attr" />
</a>
Here is the corresponding key values (notice duplicates): 
a.b=1
a.b=2.0
a.b.c=3
a.d=value
a.e.f=attr

Because EZKV supports duplicates and order matters the data is mostly not lost but this might be confusing or ambiguous. Another option is to generate XPATH based keys with indices.

Assume we load a resource with the previous XML like: 

_load_a=classpath:/a.xml5?_param_xml_mode=xpath
We will get flattened key values that look like: 
 /a/b[1]=1
 /a/b[2]=2.0
 /a/b[2]/c=3
 /a/d=value
 /a/e/@f
Because both formats may not be what you want you might want to use a filter to clean up the results.

Both modes of "xml_mode" (MODE_VALUE_XPATH and MODE_VALUE_PROPERTIES) can support array indices or not.

This module does have a service loader registration. If you do not wish to use the Service Loader you can add an instance of this class to KeyValuesSystem.Builder.

See Also:
  • ARRAY_KEY_PARAM
  • SEPARATOR_PARAM
  • MODE_PARAM
API Note
This is not included with the core ezkv module because XML requires java.xml.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    ARRAY_KEY_PARAM
    This parameter controls the array key naming scheme and is set with KeyValuesResource.parameters().
    static final String
    ARRAY_KEY_VALUE_ARRAY
    Will output array keys using array notation like a[0] instead of the default which is duplicating the keys.
    static final String
    ARRAY_KEY_VALUE_VALUE
    Will duplicate keys for array entries.
    static final String
    DEFAULT_SEPARATOR
    The default XML path separator.
    static final String
    FILE_EXT
    The file ext is "xml" but will work with XML that does not have that file ext.
    static final String
    MEDIA_TYPE
    The media type is "text/xml" and not application/xml however this media will work for all sorts of XML.
    static final String
    MODE_PARAM
    Either "properties" or "xpath" the default is "properties".
    static final String
    MODE_VALUE_PROPERTIES
    This will use properties notation where "." is the separator and duplicates do not have any array notation.
    static final String
    MODE_VALUE_XPATH
    This will use XPATH notation which for the array if there are multiple elements with the same name and parent will use array notation with 1 index notation.
    static final String
    SEPARATOR_PARAM
    Configures the separator by KeyValuesResource.parameters() with the key "xml_separator" and is by default ".".

      public static final String MEDIA_TYPE
      The media type is "text/xml" and not application/xml however this media will work for all sorts of XML.

    • FILE_EXT

      public static final String FILE_EXT
      The file ext is "xml" but will work with XML that does not have that file ext.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARRAY_KEY_PARAM

      public static final String ARRAY_KEY_PARAM
      This parameter controls the array key naming scheme and is set with KeyValuesResource.parameters(). The two values are "duplicate" (default) and "array". An example is: 
      
_load_a=classpath:/a.xml?_param_xml_arraykey=array
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARRAY_KEY_VALUE_ARRAY

      public static final String ARRAY_KEY_VALUE_ARRAY
      Will output array keys using array notation like a[0] instead of the default which is duplicating the keys.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARRAY_KEY_VALUE_VALUE

      public static final String ARRAY_KEY_VALUE_VALUE
      Will duplicate keys for array entries. For example { "a" : [ 1, 2 ] } will be 
      a=1
a=2
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SEPARATOR_PARAM

      public static final String SEPARATOR_PARAM
      Configures the separator by KeyValuesResource.parameters() with the key "xml_separator" and is by default ".".
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public static final String DEFAULT_SEPARATOR
      The default XML path separator.

      public static final String MODE_PARAM

  • Method Details

    • getMediaType

      public String getMediaType()
      Description copied from interface: KeyValuesMedia
      Returns the media type as a string and should ideally be in rfc6838 format, is required and should be unique from other KeyValuesMedia unlike KeyValuesMedia.getFileExt(). For implementers if there is not a registered media type a recommendation is to use application/x-ext where "ext" would be replaced with the file extension or some name.
      Specified by:
      getMediaType in interface KeyValuesMedia
      Returns:
      the media type

    • getFileExt

      public @Nullable String getFileExt()
      Description copied from interface: KeyValuesMedia
      Returns the file extension associated with the media type, if any. The first period "." should not be included. For example .tar.gz should be tar.gz.
      Specified by:
      getFileExt in interface KeyValuesMedia
      Returns:
      the file extension or null if not applicable
